intro: Cochlearia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles and parts of northern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in coastal areas or on rocky shores. Its leaves are variable in shape, ranging from linear to spoon-shaped, and the flowers are usually white or pale pink. The species is notable for its adaptability to different environmental conditions and its role in supporting local pollinators.
